About Us Who We Are Leadership Hanover History Capabilities Multifamily Development Industrial Development Construction Property Management Gallery Portfolio Live at Hanover Careers Working at Hanover Join The Team Contact Results Found (0) See All Results Our Leadership Guiding Excellence, Inspiring Innovation At Hanover Company, our leadership team is committed to upholding the highest standards of integrity, vision, and expertise. With decades of experience in real estate development, our leaders drive innovation, foster a culture of excellence, and create lasting value for our residents, employees, and investors. Senior Leadership Multifamily Industrial Property Management Construction Capital Markets Murry Bowden Founder & Executive Chairman View Profile Murry Bowden Founder & Executive Chairman Murry Bowden, founder of Hanover Company, has been involved in all aspects of apartment acquisitions, development, construction, management and finance since the company’s formation. He is responsible for strategic planning, risk management, operational oversight and investment decisions. Murry graduated cum laude from Dartmouth College with a Bachelor’s Degree and holds a Juris Doctorate from the University of Texas Law School. He devotes time to various charities and educational institutions. Brandt Bowden Chief Executive Officer View Profile Brandt Bowden Chief Executive Officer As Chief Executive Officer, Brandt Bowden oversees Capital, Development and Construction efforts for Hanover Company. He is integral to the planning and execution of Hanover’s corporate strategy. Brandt joined Hanover in 2002 as a Development Partner covering the East Coast. In 2009, Brandt headed Hanover’s Capital Markets division and soon took on the role of Chief Investment Officer. As CIO, he oversaw the investment and financing of approximately $5 billion in apartment development. Brandt is an active member of the Urban Land Institute and serves on the Multifamily Gold Council. He earned his Bachelor of Arts degree from Dartmouth College, and currently serves as the Houston-area District Enrollment Director. In addition, Brandt serves on the Board of Trustees at The Kinkaid School. Jeb Bowden Chief Operating Officer View Profile Jeb Bowden Chief Operating Officer As Chief Operating Officer, Jeb Bowden is responsible for the strategic oversight of Hanover Company’s Property Management, Asset Management, Global Support Services, Human Resources, Information Technology, and Accounting departments. Since joining Hanover, he has worked on over $17 billion in multifamily properties—spanning from openings to sales—across 17 U.S. markets. He has also opened development offices in Poland and Turkey, and established an operating service company in Ahmedabad, India, now employing over 100 team members. Jeb serves on Hanover’s Investment Committee for both its Multifamily and Industrial platforms. He graduated cum laude with a Bachelor of Arts from Vanderbilt University and serves on the board of the Children’s Museum of Houston. John Nash President View Profile John Nash President As President of Hanover Company, John Nash is primarily involved in managing Hanover’s risks, both legal and financial. Since joining the company in 1996, John has been involved in all aspects of the development and construction of over 75,000 apartment units. Prior to joining Hanover, John was a Partner with the firm Mayer, Brown and Platt with experience in all aspects of real estate acquisitions, sales, workouts, lending, leasing and development across all asset types. He is a graduate of the University of Texas and earned his Juris Doctorate from Southern Methodist University School of Law, where he was an Editor for the Southwestern Law Journal. John has served on the executive boards of several community organizations. John Garibaldi President – Multifamily View Profile John Garibaldi President – Multifamily John Garibaldi has been with Hanover for over 25 years, starting as a Development Partner in Houston in 1999.  During his tenure, he has been instrumental in the expansion of Hanover’s development footprint across the country and is involved in all aspects of Hanover’s apartment development, construction, management, and finance.  Previously, John was a Development Partner for both The Finger Companies and Gross Investments in Houston, and Trammell Crow Residential in the San Francisco Bay area.  John received an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business, where he was President of his graduating class. He also holds an Engineering Degree from the University of Notre Dame.  John has been involved in many local and national charitable organizations, including being on the Board of the Memorial Park Conservancy during its recent expansion and has participated in multiple Habitat for Humanity’s builds, both internationally and domestically. David Hudson President – Industrial View Profile David Hudson President – Industrial As President of the Industrial Division, David Hudson is responsible for all Hanover Company’s acquisition and development activities in the industrial sector. He has over 30 years of commercial real estate and industrial development experience with a proven track record of building industrial development platforms. Previously, David was the President of Griffin Partners Development and the Houston Business Unit Head for Duke Realty, where he led the management of both firms’ industrial development practices. David holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting from Texas Tech University, is a CPA and licensed as a Texas Real Estate Broker. Jim Fenwick President – Property Management View Profile Jim Fenwick President – Property Management As President of Property Management, Jim Fenwick is responsible for managing all property operations within the Hanover portfolio. Previously, Jim served as President for Miller-Valentine Group, a privately held, vertically integrated real estate firm, where he led a team managing more than 13,000 units in 15 states. He also served as the Northeast Executive Vice President of Equity Residential Properties, a company known as an urban and high-rise expert with oversight of more than $6 billion dollars in real estate. Jim managed their Northeast portfolio of 154 properties, which totaled more than 50,000 units in 14 states. Jim joined Hanover in 2014 and has been instrumental in establishing a service orientation, and delivering a world-class, customer-centric experience. Thomas Knutson President – Construction View Profile Thomas Knutson President – Construction Overseeing all areas of Hanover Company’s preconstruction, construction and design management activities, Thomas Knutson’s construction experience ranges from large-scale institutional work, office building, industrial warehouse, infrastructure work as well as all types of multifamily and mixed-use projects. Prior to becoming President of Construction in December 2019, Thomas served as Hanover’s Vice President of Estimating and Preconstruction, overseeing all budget efforts by the Construction division from 2009 to 2019. Before joining Hanover in 2007, Thomas worked as a Project Manager for Manhattan Construction and a Superintendent for Camden Property Trust. Thomas graduated from Texas A&M University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Construction Science. Judi Hopper Chief Financial Officer View Profile Judi Hopper Chief Financial Officer Judi Hopper joined Hanover Company in 1998 and now manages the Accounting, Tax and Financial Reporting functions. Prior to joining the company, she was an Audit Manager with Arthur Andersen, L.L.P. in Houston. Her client base consisted of a diverse group of public and private companies in the real estate, waste disposal, distribution and manufacturing industries. While at Arthur Anderson, Judi served on Hanover’s audit engagement for four years before joining the company. A Certified Public Accountant, she graduated from the University of Texas at Austin with a Bachelor of Business Administration degree and a Master’s Degree in Accounting. Roxanne Cox Chief Human Resources Officer View Profile Roxanne Cox Chief Human Resources Officer As Chief Human Resources Officer, Roxanne Cox leads Hanover Company’s HR organization. Roxanne oversees initiatives targeted at attracting, developing and retaining Hanover employees. Prior to joining Hanover, Roxanne was the Vice President of Human Capital for several global real estate operating companies, including Verde Realty and Security Capital Group. In these positions, she provided strategic oversight of the HR function, led the development of organizational leaders, and implemented innovative compensation and benefits solutions. Roxanne earned her BA, MBA, and PhD in Business with a specialization in HRM from New Mexico State University. She is certified as a Senior Professional, Human Resources (SPHR) and a SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) and sits on the University of Houston-Downtown HRM Advisory Council. Theresa Blades Chief Investment Officer View Profile Theresa Blades Chief Investment Officer Theresa Blades joined Hanover Company in 2012. As Chief Investment Officer, Theresa is primarily responsible for overseeing Hanover Company’s sourcing of equity and debt nationally and project level underwriting. Theresa holds a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Stanford University. Tami Feigl Edwards General Counsel View Profile Tami Feigl Edwards General Counsel Tami Feigl Edwards joined Hanover Company in 2015.  As General Counsel, Tami manages and supervises the legal team, which is responsible for the company’s transactional real estate and corporate legal matters.  Before joining Hanover, Tami was a partner at Norton Rose Fulbright in Houston, where she counseled a variety of clients in sophisticated real estate transactions.  She holds a Juris Doctorate from The University of Texas School of Law. Mark Friedman Vice President – Risk Management View Profile Mark Friedman Vice President – Risk Management As Vice President of Risk Management, Mark Friedman is responsible for leading and mentoring Hanover’s risk management team, including creating strategies, policies, and procedures for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risk associated with the ownership, development, investment, and management of multifamily and industrial assets. Before joining Hanover in 2019, Mark served as Senior Vice President of Risk Management at HealthPeak Properties, LOWE Enterprises, and The Irvine Company. While at HealthPeak and The Irvine Company, Mark maintained the position of President of Captive Insurance Companies. During his tenure with LOWE Enterprises, Mark served as Chair of the American Hotel and Lodging Association Risk Management Committee. Currently, he serves on the Risk Management Committee of the National Multifamily Housing Committee (NHMC). Mark has a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from California State University, Long Beach, and a Master of Business Administration from the University of California, Los Angeles, Anderson School of Management. Prior to his risk management career, Mark played on the ATP professional tennis circuit, competing in all major tournaments, including Wimbledon, the U.S. Open, and the Australian and French Open Championships. Adam Harbin Regional Development Partner – Atlanta & Florida View Profile Adam Harbin Regional Development Partner – Atlanta & Florida Adam Harbin is responsible for overseeing Hanover’s development activity throughout the Florida region and the Atlanta region.  Since joining Hanover in 2005, Adam has overseen the development of over 11,500 units and 150,000 square feet of ground-floor retail, representing over $3.5 billion in total capitalization, on projects of all product types, including high-rise, mid-rise, suburban, and mixed-use, in various markets across the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, and Southeast.  Prior to joining Hanover, Adam practiced law at the New York office of Latham & Watkins, where he worked primarily in bank and project finance.  Adam earned a Classics degree from the University of Alabama and a law degree from the University of Texas. Bo Buchanan Regional Development Partner – Carolinas & Nashville View Profile Bo Buchanan Regional Development Partner – Carolinas & Nashville Bo Buchanan has over 30 years of experience in the real estate industry. He started his career with Hanover Company in 1993 as the Corporate Controller, and has since held several positions, including Development Partner and Vice President of Property Management. Currently, Bo works on the acquisition and development of properties in the Carolinas and Nashville. His track record includes overseeing the development of over 6,000 units in North Carolina, Florida, and Virginia. Bo graduated from Texas A&M University and holds a Bachelor of Science Degree in Business. David Hall Regional Development Partner – Greater Boston & New York View Profile David Hall Regional Development Partner – Greater Boston & New York David Hall leads Hanover’s multi-family development efforts throughout greater Boston, New England and New York. His tenure at Hanover includes a dynamic portfolio of 39 urban and suburban projects, totaling over 11,000 apartment homes and over $4.4 billion in total capitalization.
